TunableVariant.name: _awareness_component
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this Sim will react to stimuli using the client-driven awareness system.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The awareness component controls how Sims play interaction-specific content to react to external stimuli. For example, a cat who is eating might look up when Sims walk by. This content is specific to the interaction. In order for awareness to work while running the Eat interaction, Eat-specific content must be authored and accounted for. Traits and other factors control and define how specific stimuli affect a Sim. Some cat, for example, might be more or less prone to be aware of their surroundings.

TunableTuple.name: _carrying_component
TunableTuple.description: Define how this Sim picks up, holds, and puts down carryable objects.

TunableVariant.name: carry_locomotion
TunableVariant.description: Define how this Sim locomotes, and by that how this Sim holds things.

TunableTuple.name: bipedal
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is bipedal. They can pick up objects using their right or left hand. They have handedness, which defines which hand they prefer to use.

TunableList.name: handedness_trait_map
TunableList.description: Associate the Sim's handedness to specific traits.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The trait associated with this specific handedness.

TunableTuple.name: quadrupedal
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is quadrupedal. They can pick up objects using their mouth, and Sims can possibly ride their back (or somehow, they can hold things on their back). They have no handedness, i.e. they cannot define whether or not they prefer to hold things in their mouth or on their back.

Tunable.name: default_put_down_strategy
Tunable.description: If the object specifies no species-specific put down tuning, fallback to this strategy.

TunableTuple.name: holstering_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Define the holstering behavior for this Sim.

TunableList.name: age_specific_behavior
TunableList.description: Define age-specific holstering behavior for this Sim. For example, toddlers always holster objects while routing (visual choice).

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The age for which this behavior applies.

TunableTuple.name: allow
TunableTuple.description: This Sim is allowed to holster objects to satisfy constraints that require free hands. The Sim will still respect the holstering restrictions defined by the interactions.

Tunable.name: always_holster_for_non_mobile_transitions
Tunable.display: Always Holster For Non Mobile Transitions
Tunable.description: If checked, this Sim will always holster all objects when executing a transition involving a non-mobile posture (whether it be the source or the destination.)

Tunable.name: always_holster_while_routing
Tunable.description: If checked, this Sim will always holster all objects when routing. If unchecked, the Sim will only holster while routing if the object is specifically tuned to exhibit this behavior.

TunableTuple.name: disallow
TunableTuple.description: This Sim is never allowed to holster. Any interaction that requires free hands is incompatible with carry.

TunableVariant.description: Define the default holstering behavior for this Sim.

TunableTuple.name: allow

TunableList.name: put_down_strategy_multipliers
TunableList.description: Define some global multiplier that affect a Sim's behavior when putting down objects. For instance, toddlers might be generally discouraged from putting objects in slots, and Wild toddlers might be generally encouraged to put objects on the floor.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: If the Sim has this trait, these multipliers are applied.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A set of overrides that can affect Put Down costs.

Tunable.name: cost_override
Tunable.description: A cost multiplier to apply to the generic cost. A multiplier that's less than 1 makes the choice more optimal, while a multiplier greater than 1 makes the choice less optimal.

Tunable.name: cost_override
Tunable.description: A cost multiplier to apply to the generic cost. A multiplier that's less than 1 makes the choice more optimal, while a multiplier greater than 1 makes the choice less optimal.

TunableVariant.name: _ensemble_component
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Sim will have specific ensemble-related functionality. This is not a requirement for Sims to be in ensembles.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: This component handles certain functionality related to ensembles.

TunableList.name: _rel_bit_ensembles
TunableList.description: A mapping of relationship bit to ensemble. A Sim will generate an ensemble with a Sim with this particular bit. e.g. A dog might want to form an ensemble with one of their owners. Dogs who chose to form an ensemble with the same Sim will share an ensemble.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The relationship bit driving the behavior.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The ensemble to form.

TunableTuple.name: _interaction_queue
TunableTuple.description: The interaction queue is a manager or ordering a Sim's pending interactions and processing them as they reach the head of the queue. The queue consists of several ListBuckets in a static priority ordering. The next interaction is found by checking the buckets in order until an interaction is found that is compatible with the Sim's current SIState.

Tunable.name: always_start_inertial
Tunable.description: If this is checked, interactions queued on this Sim always start inertial, regardless of what the content's tuning might say. This makes Sims more responsive to commands but less sticky and less likely to complete any given task.

Tunable.name: max_interactions
Tunable.description: The maximum number of visible interactions in the queue, including running interactions. If this value is greater than 10, the interaction queue .swf must be updated.

TunableList.name: _phone_affordances
TunableList.description: A list of affordances generated when the player wants to use the Sim's cell phone.

Tunable.description: An affordance that can be run as a solo interaction.

TunableList.name: _relation_panel_affordances
TunableList.description: A list of affordances that are shown when the player clicks on a Sim in the relationship panel. These affordances must be able to run as solo interactions, meaning they cannot have a target object or Sim. When the selected interaction runs, the Subject type 'PickedItemId' will be set to the clicked Sim's id. For example, a relationship change loot op with Subject as Actor and Target Subject as PickedItemId will change the relationship between the Active Sim and the Sim selected in the Relationship Panel.

Tunable.description: An affordance shown when the player clicks on a relation in the relationship panel.

TunableVariant.name: _school

TunableTuple.name: value

Tunable.name: school_career

Tunable.name: school_homework

TdescFragTag.name: school_data_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for a Sim to be added to a school career on load. Example: with EP12 installed we don't want drop outs or early graduates being forced back into school. Testing for the appropriate traits prevents that from happening, but only when EP12 is installed.

TunableTuple.name: initial_buff

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason

Tunable.name: enabled

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled

Tunable.name: buff_type

TunableTuple.name: trait_quirks
TunableTuple.description: Quirks are traits that are applied to Sims randomly. They are meant to drive behavior that should be unique, but not necessarily exposed to the player. Quirks are categorized in sets. A Sim must have one trait from each of the defined sets. Each quirk can be assigned a weight, so that some quirks are more common than others. When loading a Sim, quirks are automatically added if no quirk from the set is assigned. This means the tuning may be updated and the changes can be reflected on legacy Sims. e.g.: Dogs may be easily scared, neutral, or never scared, for example.

TunableList.name: _quirk_sets
TunableList.description: A list of all the quirk sets for this Sim. One quirk from each set is assigned.

TunableVariant.name: count
TunableVariant.description: Define how many quirks from this set the Sim is supposed to receive.

TunableTuple.name: dynamic
TunableTuple.description: The number of quirks to be equipped from this set is random. Traits can modify this number.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is going to receive between these many quirks from this set.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: trait_modifiers
TunableList.description: If the Sim is equipped with this trait, the available number of quirks is modified accordingly. NOTE: You can specify negative values to subtract from the count.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The Sim must have this trait in order for the modifier to be applied.

Tunable.name: lower_bound_modifier
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the available quirk count is modified by this amount.

Tunable.name: upper_bound_modifier
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the available quirk count is modified by this amount.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: The number of quirks to be equipped from this set is fixed.

Tunable.name: count
Tunable.description: The Sim is going to receive these many quirks from this set.

TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: A quirk set. This Sim is guaranteed to have one and only one of the quirks tuned here.

TunableTuple.description: A quirk entry. The weight is relative to other quirks in this set.

Tunable.name: quirk_relative_weight
Tunable.description: The likelihood that this quirk is assigned relative to other quirks in this quirk set.

Tunable.name: quirk_trait
Tunable.description: The trait representing this quirk.

TunableVariant.name: required_age
TunableVariant.description: If tuned the quirks will require a specific age.
